comment: Dr. Meeler has to be one of the best professors I have taken at KSU. He has great lectures "basically stories" that really help you understand what he is teaching. You will have to read two books, but the books are very interesting and give great perspective of WWI. He grades is assignments fairly and gives good feedback. No Phone and NO Sleeping.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: At the beginning of the semester, Dr. Meeler scared me. However, he does truly care about all of his students. Just be respectful, and he will respect you. We read two books + the textbook this semester and wrote in class essays on them. The books were really interesting though, so it was not difficult to get through them.

Awesome teacher, beware his lectures stray into story telling but they are interesting! Clear and fair grader, tells you what he wants, so do it. Super nice guy all bark and no bite, and was extremely understanding. Don't listen to the bad reviews about him, be prepared to read the given book and be ready to write in-person essays, super easy!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: If you like listening to lectures, take Dr. Meeler. They're engaging, though he often diverts into storytelling taking away from finishing covering the material. Two Book Review Exams, a Midterm, and a Final that are all written in Blue Books and an Oral Presentation. The more detail you add, the better your grade is. DON'T USE YOUR PHONE IN CLASS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Talk about a real gem. When everybody tells the professor thank you for the semester and they wished they could take him again, you know it is somebody worth taking. This has been the best history class I have taken at Kennesaw. He is passionate about everything he talks about. Just don't use your phone in class and you will be fine.10/10 recommend
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I've taken Dr. Meeler for WW1 and WW2 and he is by far one of my favorite professors! His lectures are amazing, I've never been so engaged for an entire class period! He's very clear about what he expects in his assignments. Grade consists of 2 book reviews and a midterm and final; the more detail you provide the better Take him take him take him!

I recommend Professor Meeler to anyone who will listen. His lectures are unlike anything I have ever had before, and he brings the two world wars to life in the classroom. He has few graded assignments, none of which are particularly difficult if you attend class and listen to the lectures. Attendance is mandatory - he may fail you if you miss 3+
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He has you read multiple books in addition to the textbook. He is a tough grader on papers. The Final for "US Military Experience" was cumulative. STUDY THE MAPS!! Every location he mentions be ready to point it out. For the papers and book reviews, focus on the 5 Ws ( Who, what, when, etc.) DO NOT GET CAUGHT UP IN YOUR EXPLANATION! Engaging Prof!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the best history professors at Kennesaw. He's passionate about what he teaches and an amazing storyteller. Show up, take notes, leave your phone in your pocket, read the books he assigns, and you'll do fine. All three of the classes he teaches are great. Take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Mr. Meeler (he accepts that for good reason) was a privilege to have as a professor. He may go into tangents in his lectures sometimes, but it's evident he's passionate about his field and what we learn from it. Do the readings even outside of class, as the books he assigns are worth their weight in gold. Took all of his courses, and loved them all
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Meeler is a wonderful professor who truly knows his stuff and cares about his students. He is a little gruff and a tough grader but definitely worth the work. As long as you read the material and write a lot you'll be fine. I went into the final with a 100 in the class. He does repeat a lot of things and gets off track but he makes it fun.

Let me be clear I dont think Dr. Meeler is a bad buy but he is extremely arrogant and unsympathetic. He constantly repeats a single point over and over in his lectures. Doesnt provide good grading criteria or feedback. If you miss class you wont pass, simple as that.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I am sad that I discovered Dr. Meeler my senior year as he is an amazing professor. I have taken all of my upper electives with him because I thoroughly enjoy his classes. Be prepared to read, but the readings he assigns is very interesting. Show up to class, do your reading, and you will be successful in his class.

Dr Meeler is by far my favorite professor at KSU. If I wasn't graduating, I would take his classes again. He is wonderful. He expects you to read, a lot. DO NOT LET HIM SEE YOU USING YOUR PHONE IN CLASS. get on his good side, and the rest of the course is smooth sailing. He is a great professor and an even better person and mentor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read
